subtitle: one of the secrets to Jewish survival
has been that we've always dealt with
the most difficult and horrific
situations and we've had many back from
Egyptian slavery through the Assyrians
through the Babylonians through the
Persians through the Greeks through the
Romans the kaks inquisitions the
Crusaders before that and of course the
Holocaust what we always did was we
cried and we cried with deep empathy but
we didn't stop there we rebuilt
we knew that we have something
stronger than anything our
enemies could ever take from us and
that's our faith our
connection and that allowed us to forge
ahead to build and become stronger than
ever so we don't ask for these type of
tragedies God forbid but when they come
like a tea bag you don't know how strong
it is until you're put into hot water
